Additional Resources

Laurel Advocacy & Referral Services; what can we say, it's in our name!

If LARS can't help you find what you need, we have additional resources for you. Check out the info below and if you have any questions, give us a call

General Resources

Maryland Community Services Locator

A tool for finding a wide variety of programs and services near you, including health, housing, legal, education, senior citizen, employment, and substance abuse resources.

Visit Site

Baltimore Neighborhoods, Inc.

Tenant-Landlord Hotline: 1-800-487-6007. Available Monday-Friday from 9am-5pm for questions about your rights as a tenant (maintenance, rent issues, etc.).

Visit Site

Maryland Resource Links

Links to several resource websites for the state of Maryland, listed by topic.

Visit Site

The Greater Laurel Literacy Center

Provides basic reading and writing skills to the Greater Laurel community FREE OF CHARGE. Call 301-498-7550 for an appointment. Located at 422 Montgomery Street in Laurel.

The Food Bank Network

Find food, health, housing, job training programs and more, anywhere.

Visit Site

Maryland Crisis Hotlines

Maryland Crisis Intervention hotlines & information

Visit Site

Homeless Resources

First Call for Help (Homeless Shelter Hotline):

Dial 2-1-1 from a landline or 1-888-731-0999. The Homeless Hotline provides emergency shelter referrals 24 hours a day, 365 days a year for homeless individuals and families in the state of Maryland.

Contact the LARS, Inc. Dev Team Here!
